title: Sideline Interview: 2025 SU Women’s Lacrosse Season Insights

meta.topic: Lacrosse dataset trends (wins/losses, avg goals, shots on goal, saves)
meta.note: Script designed for two voices: Reporter (R), Coach (C)

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: Coach Thorpe, thanks for joining us. How would you sum up the season?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: We finished 10–9. Many games were close, with just a one-goal margin.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: Your team averaged over 12 goals per game. What fueled that?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: We generated volume—538 shots, with 403 on frame, about 75 percent.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: What did you learn from the biggest win against California?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: That 18–6 win showed our ceiling when we control tempo and finish chances.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: And the toughest loss, 2–17 to Boston College?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: It reminded us to manage runs better and communicate faster on defense.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: How do you turn those tight games into wins?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: Focus on fewer turnovers and winning three more ground balls each game.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: Draw controls and ground balls—why are they so critical?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: They multiply possessions. More possessions mean more shots, more goals.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: What about goalie play with 162 saves this season?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: Improved visibility and forcing outside shots can push our save rate higher.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: Any lineup tweaks coming?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: Yes. We’ll rotate middies for fresh legs and add an initiator behind the goal.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: What are your targets for the next stretch?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: Fewer turnovers, plus three ground balls, and over 50 percent draw controls.

lines.speaker: R
lines.text: Final message for fans?

lines.speaker: C
lines.text: We’re trending up—tighter details, better possessions, and ready to finish close games.
